metadata.Title: CVE-2023-28488 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
client.c in gdhcp in ConnMan through 1.41 could be used by network-adjacent attackers (operating a crafted DHCP server) to cause a stack-based buffer overflow and denial of service, terminating the connman process.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-28488` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

connman - 1.36-2ubuntu0.1
connman-vpn - 1.36-2ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: connman package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.36-2ubuntu0.1').
